trans-unit.source: Put Block
trans-unit.target: Put Block

trans-unit.source: Put Block
trans-unit.target: Put Block

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation creates a new block to be committed as part of a blob.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation creates a new block to be committed as part of a blob.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request may be constructed as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request may be constructed as follows.

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is recommended.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is recommended.

trans-unit.source: Replace <placeholder>myaccount</placeholder> with the name of your storage account:
trans-unit.target: Replace <placeholder>myaccount</placeholder> with the name of your storage account:

trans-unit.source: PUT Method Request URI
trans-unit.target: PUT Method Request URI

trans-unit.source: HTTP Version
trans-unit.target: HTTP Version

trans-unit.source: HTTP/1.1
trans-unit.target: HTTP/1.1

trans-unit.source: Emulated Storage Service URI
trans-unit.target: Emulated Storage Service URI

trans-unit.source: When making a request against the emulated storage service, specify the emulator hostname and Blob service port as <codeInline>127.0.0.1:10000</codeInline>, followed by the emulated storage account name:
trans-unit.target: When making a request against the emulated storage service, specify the emulator hostname and Blob service port as <codeInline>127.0.0.1:10000</codeInline>, followed by the emulated storage account name:

trans-unit.source: PUT Method Request URI
trans-unit.target: PUT Method Request URI

trans-unit.target: HTTP Version

trans-unit.source: HTTP/1.1
trans-unit.target: HTTP/1.1

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="f0e3acde-f019-4148-9544-34cf2ff27211" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Using the Azure Storage Emulator for Development and Testing</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="f0e3acde-f019-4148-9544-34cf2ff27211" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Using the Azure Storage Emulator for Development and Testing</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: URI Parameters
trans-unit.target: URI Parameters

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: A valid Base64 string value that identifies the block.
trans-unit.target: A valid Base64 string value that identifies the block.

trans-unit.source: Prior to encoding, the string must be less than or equal to 64 bytes in size.
trans-unit.target: Prior to encoding, the string must be less than or equal to 64 bytes in size.

trans-unit.source: For a given blob, the length of the value specified for the <parameterReference>blockid</parameterReference> parameter must be the same size for each block.
trans-unit.target: For a given blob, the length of the value specified for the <parameterReference>blockid</parameterReference> parameter must be the same size for each block.

trans-unit.source: Note that the Base64 string must be URL-encoded.
trans-unit.target: Note that the Base64 string must be URL-encoded.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>timeout</parameterReference> parameter is expressed in seconds.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>timeout</parameterReference> parameter is expressed in seconds.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="9ae411fa-1495-42a0-bc26-c41ebca9d5b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="9ae411fa-1495-42a0-bc26-c41ebca9d5b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations</link>.

trans-unit.source: Request Headers
trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.source: The following table describes required and optional request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.source: Request Header
trans-unit.target: Request Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the authentication scheme, account name, and signature.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the authentication scheme, account name, and signature.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="96cec7bc-63cc-4227-920a-dddd850433c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Schemes</link> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="96cec7bc-63cc-4227-920a-dddd850433c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Schemes</link> for more information.

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>Date</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>x-ms-date</parameterReference>
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>Date</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>x-ms-date</parameterReference>

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for the request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for the request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="96cec7bc-63cc-4227-920a-dddd850433c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Schemes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="96cec7bc-63cc-4227-920a-dddd850433c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Schemes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Required for all authenticated requests.
trans-unit.target: Required for all authenticated requests.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Storage Service Versioning</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Storage Service Versioning</link>.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The length of the block content in bytes.
trans-unit.target: The length of the block content in bytes.

trans-unit.source: The block must be less than or equal to 4 MB in size.
trans-unit.target: The block must be less than or equal to 4 MB in size.

trans-unit.source: When the length is not provided, the operation will fail with the status code 411 (Length Required).
trans-unit.target: When the length is not provided, the operation will fail with the status code 411 (Length Required).

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: An MD5 hash of the block content.
trans-unit.target: An MD5 hash of the block content.

trans-unit.source: This hash is used to verify the integrity of the block during transport.
trans-unit.target: This hash is used to verify the integrity of the block during transport.

trans-unit.source: When this header is specified, the storage service compares the hash of the content that has arrived with this header value.
trans-unit.target: When this header is specified, the storage service compares the hash of the content that has arrived with this header value.

trans-unit.source: Note that this MD5 hash is not stored with the blob.
trans-unit.target: Note that this MD5 hash is not stored with the blob.

trans-unit.source: If the two hashes do not match, the operation will fail with error code 400 (Bad Request).
trans-unit.target: If the two hashes do not match, the operation will fail with error code 400 (Bad Request).

trans-unit.source: Required if the blob has an active lease.
trans-unit.target: Required if the blob has an active lease.

trans-unit.source: To perform this operation on a blob with an active lease, specify the valid lease ID for this header.
trans-unit.target: To perform this operation on a blob with an active lease, specify the valid lease ID for this header.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.
trans-unit.target: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1727932c-8a3b-4502-86ac-c89931d54bac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">About Storage Analytics Logging</link> and <externalLink><linkText>Azure Logging: Using Logs to Track Storage Requests</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2011/08/03/windows-azure-storage-logging-using-logs-to-track-storage-requests.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1727932c-8a3b-4502-86ac-c89931d54bac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">About Storage Analytics Logging</link> and <externalLink><linkText>Azure Logging: Using Logs to Track Storage Requests</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2011/08/03/windows-azure-storage-logging-using-logs-to-track-storage-requests.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Request Body
trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.source: The request body contains the content of the block.
trans-unit.target: The request body contains the content of the block.

trans-unit.target: Sample Request

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.

trans-unit.source: Status Code
trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 201 (Created).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 201 (Created).

trans-unit.source: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="4421ac96-38eb-4ea3-8104-f9975c3bf153" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="4421ac96-38eb-4ea3-8104-f9975c3bf153" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Response Headers
trans-unit.target: Response Headers

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Response header
trans-unit.target: Response header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: This header is returned so that the client can check for message content integrity.
trans-unit.target: This header is returned so that the client can check for message content integrity.

trans-unit.source: The value of this header is computed by the Blob service; it is not necessarily the same value specified in the request headers.
trans-unit.target: The value of this header is computed by the Blob service; it is not necessarily the same value specified in the request headers.

trans-unit.source: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.
trans-unit.target: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b20a45d8-7453-487c-b492-69dc5a5b6d2d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Troubleshooting API Operations</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b20a45d8-7453-487c-b492-69dc5a5b6d2d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Troubleshooting API Operations</link>.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the version of the Blob service used to execute the request.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the version of the Blob service used to execute the request.

trans-unit.source: This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and later.
trans-unit.target: This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and later.

trans-unit.source: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.
trans-unit.target: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.

trans-unit.source: Sample Response
trans-unit.target: Sample Response

trans-unit.source: Authorization
trans-unit.target: Authorization

trans-unit.source: This operation can be called by the account owner and by anyone with a Shared Access Signature that has permission to write to this blob or its container.
trans-unit.target: This operation can be called by the account owner and by anyone with a Shared Access Signature that has permission to write to this blob or its container.

trans-unit.source: <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> uploads a block for future inclusion in a block blob.
trans-unit.target: <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> uploads a block for future inclusion in a block blob.

trans-unit.source: A block may be up to 4 MB in size.
trans-unit.target: A block may be up to 4 MB in size.

trans-unit.source: After you have uploaded a set of blocks, you can create or update the blob on the server from this set by calling the <link xlink:href="c864893e-d758-475a-b419-af0c60dd2569" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Put Block List</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: After you have uploaded a set of blocks, you can create or update the blob on the server from this set by calling the <link xlink:href="c864893e-d758-475a-b419-af0c60dd2569" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Put Block List</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: Each block in the set is identified by a block ID that is unique within that blob.
trans-unit.target: Each block in the set is identified by a block ID that is unique within that blob.

trans-unit.source: Block IDs are scoped to a particular blob, so different blobs can have blocks with same IDs.
trans-unit.target: Block IDs are scoped to a particular blob, so different blobs can have blocks with same IDs.

trans-unit.source: If you call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> on a blob that does not yet exist, a new block blob is created with a content length of 0.
trans-unit.target: If you call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> on a blob that does not yet exist, a new block blob is created with a content length of 0.

trans-unit.source: This blob is enumerated by the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>List Blobs</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation if the <parameterReference>include=uncommittedblobs</parameterReference> option is specified.
trans-unit.target: This blob is enumerated by the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>List Blobs</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation if the <parameterReference>include=uncommittedblobs</parameterReference> option is specified.

trans-unit.source: The block or blocks that you uploaded are not committed until you call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block List</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> on the new blob.
trans-unit.target: The block or blocks that you uploaded are not committed until you call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block List</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> on the new blob.

trans-unit.source: A blob created this way is maintained on the server for a week; if you have not added more blocks or committed blocks to the blob within that time period, then the blob is garbage collected.
trans-unit.target: A blob created this way is maintained on the server for a week; if you have not added more blocks or committed blocks to the blob within that time period, then the blob is garbage collected.

trans-unit.source: The maximum blob size currently supported by the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block List</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation is 200 GB, and up to 50,000 blocks.
trans-unit.target: The maximum blob size currently supported by the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block List</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation is 200 GB, and up to 50,000 blocks.

trans-unit.source: A blob can have a maximum of 100,000 uncommitted blocks at any given time, and the set of uncommitted blocks cannot exceed 400 GB in total size.
trans-unit.target: A blob can have a maximum of 100,000 uncommitted blocks at any given time, and the set of uncommitted blocks cannot exceed 400 GB in total size.

trans-unit.source: If these maximums are exceeded, the service returns status code 413 (RequestEntityTooLarge).
trans-unit.target: If these maximums are exceeded, the service returns status code 413 (RequestEntityTooLarge).

trans-unit.source: A block that has been successfully uploaded with the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation does not become part of a blob until it is committed with <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block List</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: A block that has been successfully uploaded with the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation does not become part of a blob until it is committed with <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block List</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: Before <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block List</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is called to commit the new or updated blob, any calls to <link xlink:href="a3e943b4-5745-4e64-9d6f-728bbefbd5ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob</link> return the blob contents without the inclusion of the uncommitted block.
trans-unit.target: Before <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block List</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is called to commit the new or updated blob, any calls to <link xlink:href="a3e943b4-5745-4e64-9d6f-728bbefbd5ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob</link> return the blob contents without the inclusion of the uncommitted block.

trans-unit.source: If you upload a block that has the same block ID as another block that has not yet been committed, the last uploaded block with that ID will be committed on the next successful <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block List</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation.
trans-unit.target: If you upload a block that has the same block ID as another block that has not yet been committed, the last uploaded block with that ID will be committed on the next successful <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block List</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation.

trans-unit.source: After <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block List</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is called, all uncommitted blocks specified in the block list are committed as part of the new blob.
trans-unit.target: After <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block List</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is called, all uncommitted blocks specified in the block list are committed as part of the new blob.

trans-unit.source: Any uncommitted blocks that were not specified in the block list for the blob will be garbage collected and removed from the Blob service.
trans-unit.target: Any uncommitted blocks that were not specified in the block list for the blob will be garbage collected and removed from the Blob service.

trans-unit.source: Any uncommitted blocks will also be garbage collected if there are no successful calls to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> or <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block List</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> on the same blob within a week following the last successful <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation.
trans-unit.target: Any uncommitted blocks will also be garbage collected if there are no successful calls to <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> or <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block List</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> on the same blob within a week following the last successful <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation.

trans-unit.source: If <link xlink:href="b213c30f-8d30-4718-ba77-2030f3009719" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Put Blob</link> is called on the blob, any uncommitted blocks will be garbage collected.
trans-unit.target: If <link xlink:href="b213c30f-8d30-4718-ba77-2030f3009719" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Put Blob</link> is called on the blob, any uncommitted blocks will be garbage collected.

trans-unit.source: If the blob has an active lease, the client must specify a valid lease ID on the request in order to write a block to the blob.
trans-unit.target: If the blob has an active lease, the client must specify a valid lease ID on the request in order to write a block to the blob.

trans-unit.source: If the client does not specify a lease ID, or specifies an invalid lease ID, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the client does not specify a lease ID, or specifies an invalid lease ID, the Blob service returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: If the client specifies a lease ID but the blob does not have an active lease, the Blob service also returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).
trans-unit.target: If the client specifies a lease ID but the blob does not have an active lease, the Blob service also returns status code 412 (Precondition Failed).

trans-unit.source: For a given blob, all block IDs must be the same length.
trans-unit.target: For a given blob, all block IDs must be the same length.

trans-unit.source: If a block is uploaded with a block ID of a different length than the block IDs for any existing uncommitted blocks, the service returns error response code 400 (Bad Request).
trans-unit.target: If a block is uploaded with a block ID of a different length than the block IDs for any existing uncommitted blocks, the service returns error response code 400 (Bad Request).

trans-unit.source: If you attempt to upload a block that is larger than 4 MB, the service returns status code 413 (Request Entity Too Large).
trans-unit.target: If you attempt to upload a block that is larger than 4 MB, the service returns status code 413 (Request Entity Too Large).

trans-unit.source: The service also returns additional information about the error in the response, including the maximum block size permitted in bytes.
trans-unit.target: The service also returns additional information about the error in the response, including the maximum block size permitted in bytes.

trans-unit.source: Calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> does not update the last modified time of an existing blob.
trans-unit.target: Calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> does not update the last modified time of an existing blob.

trans-unit.source: Calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> on a page blob returns an error.
trans-unit.target: Calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Put Block</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> on a page blob returns an error.
